docs.lead_paragraph: At Maialino in the Gramercy Park Hotel, Danny Meyer, the C.E.O. of the Union Square Hospitality Group, rather bashfully explained that opening a restaurant is a lot like having a child: the conceiving is fun, but the pregnancy and birth aren't easy. The first couple of weeks after the baby is born, when you're not sleeping through the night, you think, What the heck did I do? But in time, it becomes so gratifying that you actually consider doing it all over again. Meyer would know; he has opened 14 dining establishments and has four children.

headline.main: Now Serving | When in Maialino ... (Recipe Included)

docs.lead_paragraph: Even her detractors concede that Sarah Palin will sell a lot of books. But what the book and her publicity tour will do for Ms. Palin's political future, and the future of the Republican Party or the future of the conservative movement, are subjects that bloggers of all political persuasions keep on debating even as party leaders also try to capitalize on all the publicity.
docs.abstract: If it seems it's all Sarah Palin all the time, sometimes it just is.
docs.snippet: If it seems it's all Sarah Palin all the time, sometimes it just is.

docs.lead_paragraph: After Jocelyn Morales left high school in her senior year to have a baby, she fell into a depression. Now, she has a G.E.D. and a job, but needed a grant to buy clothing for work.

docs.lead_paragraph: Is she or isn't she running for president in 2012? Sarah Palin, on ''The Oprah Winfrey Show,'' answered by borrowing the line her father used when she resigned as governor of Alaska in July: ''She's not retreating, she's reloading.''
